lines.text: We all go a little crazy sometimes, Doctor.
Yes, Ms. Matthews, but most of us come back.
Everybody goes off into their own worlds sometimes; I do!
Yes, of course we all do, but we come back.

[as he taps on Sally's shoulder]
Hey, what's your name?
Sally, what's yours?
Jake.

[Pointing at Jake's shirt]
Dirty shirt, Jake...
[first lines from off]
Why do people dream?
To see things better.
Where do people come from?
The gods made them.
Where do the gods live?
They live in every living thing.
Why did they make people?
They were bored. They needed people around to entertain them.
Why do the gods let people die?
People don't die. They go from one home to another.

[telling a story about special children]
But they could only use this sight in their dreams where there are no words.
Why are there no words?
Because it is easier to see without words.
